The Trump Administration is threatening to withdraw from another international treaty as NPR's Yuki Noguchi explains the latest involves a postal agreement Trump asserts give Chinese companies unfair advantage when they should go to the U.S
For forty four years the U.S has been part of the universal postal union which sets shipping rates for international deliveries poor developing countries including China pay lower rates well rates in the U.S and Europe are higher
Nowadays because so many products are shipped into the U.S from China the ministry she argues this amounts to a subsidy new escalation of tensions between Washington and Beijing could mean higher prices for American consumers
